item.title: Creatures of Ava: How to Clear Yellow Witherbloom
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Clear Yellow Witherbloom In Creatures of Ava
  • How To Use Krist In Creatures Of Ava

Learning the local magic in Creatures of Ava will allow you to discover new areas and creatures that were originally unreachable due to the limitations you experience while getting to know the world that surrounds you. By completing quests and getting to know the local villagers, you will eventually visit and discover Sagestones that will empower your staff – a popular weapon used in other adventure games –, enabling you to deal with the many dangers of the withering infection.

During the early stages, Creatures of Ava players will encounter the Yellow Witherbloom, a variant of the Witherbloom infection that will block shortcuts and secrets. Thankfully, clearing the Yellow Witherbloom will be possible quite early as well.

How To Clear Yellow Witherbloom In Creatures of Ava

To clear Yellow Witherbloom and make way to new areas and secrets in Creatures of Ava , you will have to follow the main quests during your adventure. Just as you did when you got the Nafitar staff at the beginning of the game, you will find what you need inside one of the several temples in Ava. You will be directed toward the one that will enable you to clear Yellow Witherbloom during the quest named "Through Stone, We Teach."

Temples themselves are not overly hard to clear in Creatures of Ava , so head to the marker on your map and clear the normal Witherbloom until you reach the Sagestone structure. Here you will need to solve a small puzzle that will require you to rotate and align puzzle pieces to form a picture – a classic puzzle seen in the most iconic puzzle games. In this case, the picture depicts some of the inhabitants of Ava sitting around a river.

If you do this successfully, your Nafitar staff will be empowered, and you will receive the Krist spell, which will enable you to clear Yellow Witherbloom. Just like the Ushun spell, the Krist spell will become available as a second spell you can use in Creatures of Ava , in this case, to clear the Yellow Witherbloom.

How To Use Krist In Creatures Of Ava

Using Krist acts like an electric surge whenever you connect your Nafitar stream with Yellow Witherbloom. You will only need to tap the button assigned to Krist while using the staff, and it will send the spell through the stream and open up the Yellow Witherbloom, making it vulnerable to the magic of your Nafitar staff. This way, you will be able to clear it like you normally would do with the normal Witherbloom.

Not only will Witherbloom be locked behind the Yellow variant of the infection, but so too will several of the creatures you find in Ava. While you can use your staff to cleanse infected creatures and attempt to tame them, some of them are affected by the Yellow variant of the WItherbloom.

You will need to keep an eye on the creature meters that appear when using your staff with said creatures and act accordingly to the encounter, since you will find yourself overwhelmed if you don't use the Krist spell when needed.

Finally, you can change which spell you assign to each spell button by pressing the RT. Once you unlock more spells across the various ecosystems in Creatures of Ava , changing which spells you use when confronted with infected creatures or different puzzles in the world will be vital.

That said, the secondary spell assigned to RT will only trigger if you tap it, since keeping it pressed will pop out the spell wheel, which can be an annoyance – you can't rebind each action, but time slows down when you bring up the wheel.

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals Community Day Dates for September, October, and November 2024
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO announces next 3 Community Day events for upcoming season to keep players engaged.
  • Specifically, players will want to keep September 14, October 5, and November 10 in mind for upcoming Community Day events.
  • Unfortunately, no further details were provided, but fans can look forward to Beldum and Popplio for August Community Day events.

Pokemon GO confirms the next three Community Day event dates happening within the upcoming season. The mobile title continues to be a popular one for players, part of which could be due to Pokemon GO 's live-service nature. As such, the game is constantly refreshing itself with new content, quests, and other activities to try to keep players logging in each day to see what sort of new things there are to do or Pokemon have spawned in.

While not every Pokemon GO update has been a hit with fans, the game does have a very stable set of events that typically happens each month. These include things like Raid Events, themed weeks, and, of course, the monthly Community Day which puts a specific Pokemon in the spotlight for a set number of hours on a particular day. For many fans, these Community Day activities are a great way to catch a high stat version as well as potentially capturing a rare shiny variant. With the next season rapidly approaching, Pokemon GO is giving all players a heads up on when to expect to see the next trio of Community Day events.

In a new blog post, Niantic revealed a handful of important dates that Pokemon GO players will want to keep in mind for the upcoming season. Specifically, fan favorite Community Day events in Pokemon GO have been confirmed for the next three months with the first arriving on September 14, followed by October 5, and then November 10, closing out the seasonal trio of events.

Pokemon GO Community Day Dates for September, October, and November 2024

  • Saturday, September 14, 2024
  • Saturday, October 5, 2024
  • Sunday, November 10, 2024

While there's still plenty of mystery surrounding these events, including which Pokemon could be featured as well as the times they'll be available from, Niantic didn't stop there with new events on the horizon. In the upcoming Pokemon GO season, Niantic also confirmed a handful of other in-game events to keep an eye out for, specifically a new Raid Day on Sunday, September 8 and Saturday, October 12. Similarly, two additional Research Day events are also on the way, with the first launching on Sunday September 22 and a second on Sautrday, October 19. Again, details are limited, with Niantic indicating more information is on the way at a later date.

In the meantime, Niantic has recently confirmed the August Community Day Classic details, launching on August 18 with the "Iron Ball Pokemon" Beldum being featured. As expected, Beldum will be appearing much more frequently in the wild, with evolutions happening up to two hours after the event giving Metagross the Meteor Mash charged attack. Egg hatch distance is also being reduced by a quarter, lures and incense will last 3 hours, and taking snapshots during this event may generate a surprise.

item.title: The Sims 4 Lovestruck's New Milestones and Aspirations Explained
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sims 4: Lovestruck introduces new dating features like Romantic Explorer and Paragon Partner aspirations for love-seeking sims.
  • Romantic Explorer aspiration focuses on exploring romance with milestones like romantic gestures and achieving high romance skills.
  • Paragon Partner aspiration delves into polyamorous relationships with milestones like establishing boundaries and dating multiple sims.

A decade after The Sims 4 launched, EA finally released a dating-centered expansion pack: The Sims 4: Lovestruck . Like dating expansion packs in previous iterations of The Sims 4 , Lovestruck aims to spice up the game's romance mechanic by adding new social interactions, dating activities, and buy mode items. In addition, The Sims 4: Lovestruck also includes a new neighborhood called Ciudad Enamorada, known for its romantic vibe, nightclubs, and other dating hotspots for sims to explore and find love.

Among The Sims 4: Lovestruck's many new features are two new romance-centered aspirations: Romantic Explorer and Paragon Partner. These new aspirations expanded The Sims 4's Love aspiration and were added alongside Serial Romantic and Soulmate. What sets the Romantic Explorer and Paragon Partner apart is that both include a list of milestones players must complete to fulfill their chosen aspirations, resulting in rewards and dating perks.

The Sims 4: Lovestruck - Romantic Explorer Aspiration and Milestones

The Romantic Explorer aspiration in The Sims 4: Lovestruck is perfect for romantics at heart. With this aspiration selected, Sims aims to explore every single dating interaction available in the game and experience romance to the fullest. The Sims 4's Romantic Explorer aspiration is perfect for players who love to partake in as many romantic activities as possible, from going on dates to being physically intimate with their partner, keeping the fire of romance burning for as long as possible.

The milestones players must complete to be successful in the Romantic Explorer aspiration well reflect the outgoing and engaging nature of this aspiration. Sims, who are Romantic Explorers, have three levels of milestones to complete: Spark of Love, Expanding Boundaries, and Amour Connoisseur. Each of these levels will have sims get to know their dates, discuss romantic boundaries with their partner, increase their sims' romance skills, and perform several romantic gestures, which includes having to WooHoo in three different locations, among many others.

The Sims 4: Lovestruck Romantic Explorer Aspiration Milestones

1. Spark of Love

2. Expanding Boundaries

3. Amour Connoisseur

a. Go on a Get to Know You Date

a. Discuss Romantic Boundaries

a. Get Gold on a Romantic Date

b. Achieve Level 2 Romance Skill

b. Have a Romantic Partner

b. Achieve Level 7 Romance Skill

c. Use the Romantic Blanket three times for romance

c. Achieve Level 4 Romance Skill

c. Perform 25 romantic gestures with a partner Sim

d. Share food two times

d. Embrace three times

d. WooHoo three times at different locations

The Sims 4: Lovestruck - Paragon Partner Aspiration and Milestones

One of the new features introduced in The Sims 4: Lovestruck is polyamorous relationships, which are highlighted in the Paragon Partner aspiration. Sims who choose the Paragon Partner aspiration aim to have successful relationships with two or more sims simultaneously. While the Romantic Explorer aspiration is focused on the many activities and interactions sims can partake in with their partner, the Paragon Partner aspiration revolves around having multiple relationships with established romantic boundaries.

It is worth noting that the milestones players must complete in the Paragon Partner aspiration are much smaller compared to the Romantic Explorer. To fulfill the Paragon Partner aspiration, players need only to complete one milestone, which will involve establishing romantic boundaries in The Sims 4 , having at least two partners, and going on several dates with a partner sim. Like the Romantic Explorer, fulfilling the Paragon Partner aspiration will earn players rewards, such as aspiration points that players can spend in the reward store, alongside a new reward trait that would help players maintain relationships more easily in The Sims 4.

The Sims 4: Lovestruck Paragon Partner Aspiration Milestone

1. Paragon Partner

a. Discuss Romantic Boundaries

b. Have 2 or more Partners

c. Have 2 or more Very Satisfied Relationships

d. Go on 3 Dates with a partner Sim

While the two new aspirations do not require specific traits, equipping sims with traits that complement their chosen aspiration would make it easier to complete milestones.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies Reveals Wonder Weapons, Returning Items, and More
item.description:
Highlights

  • Black Ops 6 Zombies brings back fan-favorite features like Gobblegum buffs and the Pack-A-Punch machine.
  • Players can expect a new wonder weapon, a boxing glove-wielding perk machine, and an injectable serum for powerful armor in Black Ops 6.
  • The upcoming game's new Terminus map resembles Mob of the Dead from Black Ops 2, while Liberty Falls promises an American town setting.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has released an exciting new Zombies trailer showcasing one of the two launch maps, a new wonder weapon, and a host of returning features. Set in the early 90s, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 picks up after the events of 2020's Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War , and is also a direct sequel to the fan-favorite Black Ops 2 . Black Ops 6 is looking to launch with 16 original multiplayer maps, and is rumored to be adding a slew of remastered Black Ops 2 maps post-launch.

It's been four years since the last round-based Zombies experience in Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War. Since then, Zombies fans have been clamoring for a return to form for the beloved mode after Call of Duty: Vanguard 's experimental Zombies experience underwhelmed a year later. Last year, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 became the first ever Modern Warfare entry to feature a Zombies co-op mode in the name of MWZ. The open world Warzone -style experience satisfied fans of more recent Call of Duty entries, but fans of classic Zombies felt largely disappointed by the mode.

In the lead-up to the return of round-based Zombies in Black Ops 6 , a new trailer dropped giving fans a deeper look at one of the game's two launch maps, Terminus, an island prison reminiscent of the fan-favorite Black Ops 2 map Mob of the Dead. The enthralling trailer gives a brief glimpse at a new Wonder Weapon, called the Beam Smasher, which emits a powerful yellow beam to slice up Zombies with. An interesting new boxing glove-wielding perk machine named Melee Macchiato was also shown giving players powerful melee punching attacks, and a new injectable serum gives players a powerful armor suit to blast their way through the zombie hordes with.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Terminus Zombies Trailer

With Black Ops 6 returning to round-based Zombies for the first time in four years, it seems fitting that it would include the return of several Call of Duty Zombies staples. This new trailer confirmed the return of the Gobblegum buffs that were first introduced in Black Ops 3 . Additionally, the essential Pack-A-Punch machine, Mystery Boxes, and the often life-saving Monkey Bombs will be at players' disposal as well. The past decade of Call of Duty Zombies has seen many new systems introduced that may have over-complicated the round-based Zombies experience. Based off this trailer, it seems Black Ops 6 's Zombies mode will be more refined and not as needlessly complex as some previous Call of Duty Zombies offerings.

The Black Ops 6 Terminus trailer concluded with a short tease of the game's second launch map, Liberty Falls, letting fans know they can tune into Call of Duty Next on August 28 to catch live gameplay of the upcoming Zombies map. Liberty Falls seems to be a much lighter setting compared to Terminus, as it looks to take place in a small American town. Black Ops 2 's classic Jet Gun wonder weapon also made a brief blink-and-you'll-miss-it appearance during the Liberty Falls tease. There seems to be a lot for fans of earlier Call of Duty Zombies games to look forward to when Black Ops 6 drops on October 25.

item.title: Developer Behind One of 2018's Best Games Reveals New Project
item.description:
Highlights

  • Radical Fish Games, known for the action role-playing game CrossCode, has announced its new project, Alabaster Dawn.
  • The upcoming game will be a top-down 2.5D action RPG with a retro art style.
  • A demo is scheduled to be released on Steam in early 2025.

Radical Fish Games, the studio behind the hit 2018 game CrossCode , has revealed more details about its newest project. Originally titled Project Terra, Radical Fish Games has now officially announced the name and released a reveal trailer for the CrossCode successor, Alabaster Dawn .

In 2018, Radical Fish Games released the action RPG CrossCode for PC. CrossCode was later released for consoles including Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and Nintendo Switch in 2020. The game was set in the distant future and featured a retro-inspired art style with incredibly smooth and satisfying physics. CrossCode was well received by players, earning several awards and currently boasting a 94% positive review rating on Steam.

With the success of CrossCode , Radical Fish Games began development on another project, Project Terra, a few years ago. In the latest update on the project, the team revealed the new title's official name and released the first official trailer. Alabaster Dawn will be another top-down 2.5D action RPG featuring a similar retro art style as CrossCode . Players will solve intricate puzzles, battle enemies in a deeply engaging combat system, and unravel the secrets of a deep and compelling story within Alabaster Dawn .

CrossCode Creators Announce New Project, Alabaster Dawn

Alabaster Dawn is set to build upon the best aspects of the studio's previous game, as the artwork, combat, and overall aesthetic of the game are incredibly similar to that of CrossCode but with a higher level of polish. In Alabaster Dawn, players will take on the role of Juno, the Outcast Chosen, and attempt to awaken the rest of humanity and the gods after the falling of the Shadow of Nyx. Players will have to rebuild settlements, advance science, and open new and interesting paths in the massive world around them, all while exploring the various structures and secrets scattered throughout the title to figure out where the gods have gone.

Although only the first few hours of gameplay are completed, Alabaster Dawn is set to have a public demo released in early 2025 on Steam. The game is currently available to wishlist on Steam and Radical Fish Games will have a booth at this year's Gamescom with an updated demo of Alabaster Dawn for players to try out. Alongside this, Radical Fish Games is considering releasing the game in early access in late 2025, similar to what they did with the release of CrossCode. Regardless, players will have another epic retro-style action RPG game to look forward to in the near future.
